text: realistically within the first week that
you stopped working out you already
start to lose gains now it's not
exponential to the point where you're
right back to baseline but there are
noticeable changes within one to two
weeks and so you do d-train fairly
quickly and honestly within one to three
months depending on how condition you
were in the first place you can be back
to where you were at baseline before you
really started training the good thing
is they come back fairly quickly too
but what happens is taking a week off
now and then is actually a really good
idea you know your body needs a break
especially if you've been training
really hard so that's not the worst part
where we run into problems is when
people take that week off and that we
turns into another week and then turns
into another week most people will be
surprised by how quickly you can lose
some of the conditioning that you've
worked to build for so long rather than
taking a full week off what you might be
able to do is go in and take an easy
week once in a while that's kind of more
of a a maintenance or unloading week and
then from there you can get right back
to where you were the next week
[Music]
